list.title: Question 1
list.content:
Prove that the sum of three consecutive positive integers is divisible
by333.
list.markScheme:
Letn,n+1n, \, n + 1n,n+1andn+2n+2n+2be three consecutive positive integers for
somen∈Z+n \in \mathbb{Z^{+}}n∈Z+.The sum of the three integers isn+(n+1)+(n+2)=3n+3=3(n+1)[multiple of3]\begin{aligned}
\hspace{8em} n + (n + 1) + (n+2) &= 3n + 3 \\[6pt]
&= 3(n+1) \hspace{3em} [\text{multiple of $3$}]\end{aligned}n+(n+1)+(n+2)​=3n+3=3(n+1)[multiple of 3]​Hence the sum of three consecutive positive integers is divisible by333.

list.title: Question 2
list.content:
Consider two consecutive positive integers,kkkandk+1k+1k+1.Show that the difference of their squares is equal to the sum of the two
integers.
list.markScheme:
The difference of the squares ofkkkandk+1k+1k+1is(k+1)2−k2=k2+2k+1−k2=2k+1=k+(k+1)[sum ofkandk+1]\begin{aligned}
\hspace{9.5em}(k+1)^2 - k^2 &= k^2 + 2k + 1 - k^2 \\[6pt]
&= 2k + 1 \\[6pt]
&= k + (k + 1) \hspace{3em} [\text{sum of $k$ and $k+1$}]\end{aligned}(k+1)2−k2​=k2+2k+1−k2=2k+1=k+(k+1)[sum ofkandk+1]​Hence the difference of the squares of two consecutive positive integers
is equal to their sum.

list.title: Question 3
list.content:
The product of three consecutive integers is increased by the middle
integer.Prove that the result is a perfect cube.
